column1: University of North Carolina - Chapel Hill
Look at process for getting visa - international students. - struggle for low-income international students to come to campus because of visa requirements
Gov. wants proof of means to afford life in U.S.
Look at currently available data -- look at post-graduation data (CCE)
Looks at Brooking's - Pearlriver Community College tends to beat Columbia FA
try to use interviews to zoom into data
check Dept. of Education data set(s)
Is this issue b/c Columbia didn't think out long-term policy os it because loans are more expensive?

Why are we seeing these affordability issues now? What is causing this? Is previous financial support being taken away? Why is this the case today? Is the push for 'diversity' why affordability issues are becoming bigger? Do Universities need to rethink policies as they push to be more accessible?
Keep conversation going - write articles about food (in)security, homelessness, poverty, etc.
- Start talking with Prof. O'H for research tips
talk with students on GI Bill that give voucher instead of money -- get someone into looking at GS
how do we institionalise a tracking measure to make sure people don't forget about it
TREAT THIS like a scientific research paper. What question are we tring to answer? hypothesis, methods, etc.
look at undergrad. vs. graduate affordability issues
look at Quality of Life (Senate) aggregate data - being released over next year -- contact Zach and Marc
Contact Senate again to get updates
Read Harvard graduating class survey (about overall college experience) - look at economic diversity
look into Professors here doing research into similar field -- get ideas (ex. Esther Fuchs, Rimon Fiseman, school of social work and teacher's college)
long term: after-college . What's Columbia doing to prepare students for after college?
